subject: Re: [junit] ETA?
msgSnippet: Matthew, I ll take a shot at question 2: I think the current JUnit 4 is definitely worth using.  The test-writers API has been stable for over six months,
messageBody:
Matthew,

I'll take a shot at question 2: I think the current JUnit 4 is
definitely worth using. The test-writers' API has been stable for over
six months, although the extension API has continued to evolve. I've
been using both on several outside projects since last summer.

David Saff

mattpeddlesden wrote:

> Apologies, I fully expect a good telling off for asking this but I
> just can't find any clues...
>
> We're currently developing a new test strategy and implementation for
> our products and it seems that Junit 4 is quite close but not here
> fully yet.
>
> o What's the rough ETA (Q1, Q2 etc)?
> o Is the current Junit 4 worth using anyway?
>
> Thanks in advance!
>
> Regards
> Matthew Peddlesden
> Head of Product Development, ValidSoft Ltd.
>
>
>
>
>
>
>
>
